meanings.definition: To make familiar by use or practice.
meanings.sent1: She would accustom herself to the new routine at school.
meanings.sent2: He accustoms himself to waking up early for work every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to accustom itself to wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The plant accustoms to the sunlight, reaching for it every morning.
meanings.sent5: Accustoming to the cold water, she slowly entered the pool.

meanings.sent1: The puppy quickly accustoms to its new home with lots of toys.
meanings.sent2: They accustom themselves to the local customs when traveling.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to accustom to human emotions, but it was confusing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind accustoms to the idea of change, slowly accepting it.
meanings.sent5: Accustoming to the dark, he navigated the cave with ease.
